biography.value:
Shawn Wood

Gifted with druidic magic, a grung wildling typically serves as an advisor, a healer, and a nurturer of crops.

Grungs[â€“]

Grungs are frog-like folk found in rain forests and tropical jungles. These amphibians prefer shade and live in trees, but they maintain hatcheries for their offspring in well-guarded ground-level pools. About three months after hatching, a grung tadpole takes on the shape of an adult, and after another six months, the grung reaches maturity.

Born in a wide range of colors, grungs most often appear in shades of green, blue, purple, red, orange, and gold. All grungs secrete a substance that is harmless to them but poisonous to other creatures, and sometimes that substance has a special effect based on the grung's color (see "Variant: Grung Poison"). They also use this venom to poison their weapons.

description.value: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+5]]{+5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 ([[/damage 1d4 + 3 type=piercing]]) damage plus 5 ([[/damage 2d4 type=poison]]) damage.
Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+5]]{+5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 ([[/damage 1d4 + 3 type=piercing]]) damage plus 5 ([[/damage 2d4 type=poison]]) damage.
Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+5]]{+5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 ([[/damage 1d6 + 3 type=piercing]]) damage plus 5 ([[/damage 2d4 type=poison]]) damage.
The grung can breathe air and water.

A creature &Reference[condition=poisoned] by a grung suffers an additional effect that depends on the grung's color. This effect lasts until the creature is no longer &Reference[condition=poisoned] by the grung. The &Reference[condition=poisoned] creature feels a desperate need to soak itself in liquid or mud. It can't take actions or move except to do so or to reach a body of liquid or mud.
The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

If the grung isn't immersed in water for at least 1 hour during a day, it suffers 1 level of &Reference[condition=exhaustion] at the end of that day. The grung can recover from this &Reference[condition=exhaustion] only through magic or by immersing itself in water for at least 1 hour.

This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to [[/r 1d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

materials.value: seven sharp thorns or seven small twigs, each sharpened to a point

description.value:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range:

  • You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
  • You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
  • You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Spellcasting.

The grung casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):

  • At will: @UUID[Actor.ZHMlyDGZbe1V06M4.Item.NrO6kftdZrN3bB3u]

  • 3/day each: @UUID[Actor.ZHMlyDGZbe1V06M4.Item.ADch5E0qgpNfduan], @UUID[Actor.ZHMlyDGZbe1V06M4.Item.Ig6IKbEc1OUMorvx]

  • 2/day: @UUID[Actor.ZHMlyDGZbe1V06M4.Item.RuIiCKDjKQqGsvQg]
